overview:
Spencer E. Ante has been writing about technology and finance for more than 15 years. He is currently a Deputy Bureau Chief at The Wall Street Journal.

He is an award-winning journalist and author of the critically acclaimed book, Creative Capital: Georges Doriot and the Birth of Venture Capital (Harvard Business Press, April 2008).

Ante covered the dot com boom from San Francisco before moving back to New York City in 2000, where he is currently based. He is a former reporter at PC World, Wired News and TheStreet.com, and editor of BusinessWeek, where he worked for 10 years. He also appears frequently on CNBC, Fox and other news outlets, and has given keynote speeches at Stanford University, IBM and the National Venture Capital Association, and other places.
